results.title: Deaf Culture (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Adult Hearing Centre for Deaf and Hearing Impaired Persons
results.brief_description: Hearing people ask: What is it? What does it mean? Can we really speak about Deaf culture? Steve Ripley knows the worlds of the hearing and the deaf. He has travelled widely and tells his experiences in vivid sign language. A voice interpreter and subtitles are provided for those not fluent in sign language.

results.title: Deadly spiders
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Wild Life”.
Illustrates and describes several species of spiders, some of which, although appearing most frightening, are quite harmless. The film warns against the poisonous varieties, such as the red-back and the deadly funnel web spiders. The spinneret fangs, poison sacs, and eyes of the funnel web are shown in detail. First aid treatment of a bite by a spider is demonstrated. The film also makes suggestions on how to preserve those species of spiders which are beneficial to man.

results.title: Deadly game of nations
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bill Brind, John Kramer and Paul Cowan
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “War”.
All through history, wars have been linked to feelings of nationalism. There is hardly any country in the world that did not establish iself by means of wars. In this film Gwynne Dyer explors some of the reasons why pople, and governments acting on their behalf, feel the need to keep armies and fight wars. It focuses on Israel’s struggle for a secure place amongst the Arab nations of the Middle East, and on the so far unsuccessful attempts of the Palestinians to create a nation of their own.

results.title: Deadly females
results.brief_description: A spider spins a silken web with which to ensnare its food; a moth is caught. Next the trapdoor spider uses its silk glands to construct its home and conceal the entrance with a perfectly hinged door. Two male scorpions fight for the favour of a female of the species, and the victorious male is later devoured by the female in a nuptial feast.

results.title: Deadly Australians. Episodes 3&4
results.brief_description: This video describes some of the most dangerous animals in Australia, and some which you would not think are dangerous! Presented by Tina Dalton, we investigate creatures found in the ‘Arid and wetland environment’, such as snakes, kangaroos and crocodiles, and ‘Perils in suburbia’, dangerous creatures that are encountered around homes and suburbs, such as spiders, ants and bees.

results.title: Deadly Australians. Episodes 1&2
results.brief_description: This video describes some of the most dangerous animals on Australia, and some which you would not think dangerous! Presented by Tina Dalton, we investigate creatures from the ‘Coastal and ocean environment’, such as Jelly fish and sharks, and from the ‘Forest environment’, such as the Cassowary and other rainforest species.

results.title: Deadly (A)
results.creator_credit: Beyond Films, Moirstorm Productions, Richard Moir and Esben Storm
results.brief_description: To clear his name, disgraced city cop Tony Bourke (Jerome Ehlers) is sent to file a report on the “suicide” hanging of a local Aborigine in a remote outback gaol. His orders are to clean things up quickly and quietly but, in a town ready to explode with racial tension, Bourke uncovers a web of suspicion and the truth behind a deadly secret. A fast-paced thriller and intriguing and powerful story of conspiracy, cover-up and cold-blooded murder. Features Tony Barry and Bill Hunter.

results.title: Deadlock
results.brief_description: The film starts when Anna (played by Kerry Fox) has called the police to arrest her defacto Serge (played by Raj Sidhu). The film explores their relationship and how the violent tendencies of Serge develop and worsen over time. The line has been crossed. What was frustration and anger has been revealed to be a pattern of violent behaviour. Anna observes this and decides to take action, albeit not soon enough.

results.title: Deadline
results.creator_credit: Blue Tongue Films and Nash Edgerton
results.brief_description: Drummoyne 4.50 pm - a young man races across various Sydney suburbs, headed for Kings Cross, at a furiously reckless pace. Accompanied by a rocking punk-skater soundtrack this Australian short film amuses greatly with its almost dialogue-less encounters and frenetic pace. Cast includes Nash Edgerton and John Polson.

results.title: Dead to the world
results.brief_description: An impassioned battle between the conscience and corruption set in inner-city Newtown, once the boxing centre of Sydney, domain of the working class immigrants and now ripe for property development and speculation. For Alexander Polonski, owner of the districts most celebrated boxing gym, this means trouble. His gym is prime real estate and many factions are coveting it. As the story moves towards a violent climax, everyone must decide what they want, how they might get it, and just where they would draw the line in the quest for satisfaction. An innovative Australian feature film.
